questions.text: A 15 year old boy was diagnosed with Ependymoma of the fourth ventricle. All of the following structures can be damaged in this patient, except?

Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis is a severe Mucocutaneous reaction, usually to drugs characterised by sloughing and blistering. What is the percentage of patients affected by body surface area required to make a diagnosis for the same?
questions.explanation:
Disease Affected BSA
Stevens-Johnson’s syndrome <10%
Stevens-Johnson’s syndrome overlap with Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis 10-20%
Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis >30%

questions.text: A 25 year old female was brought to you as she fainted few minutes back. You as a doctor, checked her pulse first and now you plan to check her blood pressure. Which of the following statements is true regarding the location of placing your Stethoscope diaphragm?

options.label: A
options.text: Biceps tendon is lateral to Brachioradialis muscle

options.label: B
options.text: Brachial artery is located medial to median nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Radial nerve is medial to Pronator teres muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Brachialis muscle forms the medial part of the floor

questions.correct_answer: D. Brachialis muscle forms the medial part of the floor

questions.text: A 50-year-old female was diagnosed with Adenocarcinoma of the lung involving the phrenic nerve. Which among the following statements is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Mediastinal pleura and Diaphragmatic pleura over the dome lacks nerve input

options.label: C
options.text: Only mediastinal pleura becomes non functional

options.label: D
options.text: Only the periphery of diaphragmatic pleura lacks nerve supply

questions.correct_answer: B. Mediastinal pleura and Diaphragmatic pleura over the dome lacks nerve input

questions.text: A group of boys were playing in a park where a boy accidentally fell down while playing the swing from a reasonable height. He sustained a blunt trauma to his abdomen and was brought to the doctor complaining of abdominal pain. On examination, a tender mass on one side of rectus sheath was noted. Which vessel is more likely to be the reason in this condition?
A person will be held responsible for a crime in ?
questions.explanation:
85 IPC Nothing is an offence done by a person who wasInvoluntaryIntoxicatedAn act done by a person who is incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to intoxication isnot an offenceif the thing which intoxicated him wasadministered to him without his knowledgeor against his will.
86 IPC Criminal act done aftervoluntary intoxicationis an OffenceAn intoxicated person (voluntary drunkenness) iscriminally responsibleif he had the intention or knowledge of committing a crime.

questions.text: While performing surgery in a patient of hip fracture, the surgeon accidentally cut the obturator membrane. Which of the following is true regarding the pathway and insertion of a muscle that originates from this damaged structure respectively?

options.label: A
options.text: Greater Sciatic foramen and Greater trochanter of femur

options.label: B
options.text: Lesser Sciatic foramen and Lesser trochanter of femur

options.label: C
options.text: Lesser Sciatic foramen and Greater trochanter of femur

options.label: D
options.text: Greater Sciatic foramen and Lesser trochanter of femur

questions.correct_answer: C. Lesser Sciatic foramen and Greater trochanter of femur

questions.text: A triad in thallum poisoning includes all of the following, EXCEPT ?
An injury caused by Seat belt commonly involves?
A 45 year old patient was diagnosed with colorectal cancer over sigmoid colon and rectum. Which group of lymph node does not drain the region where the cancer is involved?
A 29 year old was accused for her 22 year old female friend who was unconscious after a drink, what test would be done that will test on his urethral swab for the presence of vagina cells ?

A 45 year old male, who is working in a paint factory for more than 19 years, now presented with complaints of pain abdomen, ataxia and constipation. On Peripheral blood smear basophilic stippling of RBCs are see. He is suffering from poisoning due to:
questions.explanation:
Chronic lead poisoning (plumbism/Saturnism/Saturnine poisoning)
  • Facial pallor Q (early sign)
  • Basophilic stipplingQ
  • Burtonian lineQ
  • Lead palsy
  • Lead encephalopathy
  • Wrist drop/foot drop
  • Lead coli, constipation
  • Sterility
  • Nephropathy

Diagnosis

  • Lead > 0.03 mg% is diagnostic
  • X-ray-radiopaque bands at metaphysesQ of long bones
  • ↑ALAQ & coproporphyrinQ in urine

questions.text: Correct match in measuring lengths of long bones using osteometric board for assessing stature is ?

options.label: B
options.text: Tibia – medial condyle to tip of medial malleolus

options.label: C
options.text: Fibula – tip of the head to tip of lateral malleolus

questions.correct_answer: C. Fibula – tip of the head to tip of lateral malleolus

questions.text: An asymptomatic middle-aged woman is found to have a serum sodium level of 125 mEq/L after routine laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Which of the following is the most appropriate management strategy for this patient?

A 60 year old woman develops acute kidney injury postoperatively. She is oliguric and her potassium is 7.5. ECG shows peaked T-waves. Which of the following therapies should be administered to stabilize the myocardium?

A 22-year-old man sustains severe blunt trauma to the back. He notes that he cannot move his lower extremities. He is hypotensive and bradycardic. Which of the following is the best initial management of the patient?
Following a weekend of skiing, a man comes to the emergency department with pain, numbness, and discoloration of his right forefoot. Which of the following is the best initial treatment of the foot?

A 19-year-old man presents with a skin and soft tissue infection after sustaining a human bite to his left arm in a bar brawl a week prior. Which of the following species of organisms is most likely to be cultured from the wound?
A person after sitting for long hours developed numbness of the medial side of buttocks. Which nerve is responsible for this symptom?
questions.explanation:
BRANCHES DISTRIBUTION
Superior gluteal nerve Gluteus medius, gluteus minimus, and tensor fasciae latae muscle
Inferior gluteal nerve Gluteus maximus muscle
Nerve to piriformis Piriformis muscles
Nerve to obturator internus Obturator internus and superior gemellus muscles
Nerve to quadratus femoris Quadratus femoris and inferior gemellus muscles
Perforating cutaneous nerve Skin over medial aspect of the buttock
Posterior cutaneous nerve of the thigh Skin over posterior surface of the thigh and popliteal fossa and also over the lower part of the buttock, scrotum, or labium majus
Sciatic nerve (L4, 5; S1, 2, 3), tibial portion Hamstring muscles (semitendinosus, biceps femoris (long head], adductor magnus (hamstring part), gastrocnemius, soleus, plantaris, popliteus, tibialis posterior, flexor digitorum longus, flexor hallucis longus, and via medial and lateral plantar branches to muscles of sole of foot; sural branch supplies the skin on the lateral side of the leg and foot
Common fibular (peroneal portion) Biceps femoris muscle (short head) and via deep fibular branch: tibialis anterior, extensor hallucis longus, extensor digitorum longus. fibularis tertius, and extensor digitorum brevis muscles; the skin over the cleft between the first and second toes. The superficial fibular branch supplies the fibularis longus and brevis muscles and the skin over the lower third of anterior surface of the leg and the dorsum of the foot
Pudendal nerve Muscles of the perineum including the external and sphincter, mucous membrane of the lower half of the canal, periananl skin, skin of the penis, scrotum, clitoris and labia majora and minora

questions.text: An man sustains a right-sided neck laceration after an assault. Which of the following is a relative, rather than an absolute, indication for neck exploration?

A man decelerated rapidly in order to avoid hitting another car and swerved into a ditch. He now complains of chest pain. Which of the following findings on chest x-ray would be most suspicious for an aortic injury?

options.label: D
options.text: Widening of the mediastinum greater than 8 cm

questions.correct_answer: D. Widening of the mediastinum greater than 8 cm

questions.text: A diabetic man receives a renal allograft. Cyclosporine is given as one of the anti rejection medications. Which of the following functions does cyclosporine A primarily inhibit?

A 61-year-old man undergoes upper endoscopy for evaluation of weight loss and epigastric pain and is identified to have a submucosal mass in the stomach. Biopsy is consistent with a gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST). Workup reveals the presence of liver metastases. Which of the following is the best initial treatment for this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Monoclonal antibody against tumor necrosis factor α (infliximab)

options.label: D
options.text: Monoclonal antibody against epidermal growth factor receptor (cetuximab)

questions.text: X is a muscle supplied by lateral plantar nerve. X assists flexor digitorum longus in flexing lateral four toes. What is X?
questions.explanation:
Muscle ORIGIN INSERTION NERVE SUPPLY NERVE ROOT ACTION
First Layer
Abductor hallucis Medial tuberosity of calcaneum and flexor retinaculum Base of proximal phalanx of big toe Medial plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexor and abducts big toe; braces medial longitudinal arch
Flexor digitorum brevis Medial tubercle of calcaneum Four tendons to four lateral toes – inserted into borders of middle phalanx; tendon perforated by those of flexor digitorum longus Medial plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexes lateral four toes; braces medial and lateral longitudinal arches
Abductor digiti minimi Medial and lateral tubercle of calcaneum Base of proximal phalanx of fifth toe Lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexes and abducts fifth toe; braces lateral longitudinal arch
Second layer
Quadratus plantae Medial and lateral sides of calcaneum Tendon of flexor digitorum longus Lateral Plantar nerve S2, 3 Assists flexor digitorum longus in flexing lateral four toes
Lumbricals (4) Tendons of flexor digitorum longus Dorsal extensor expansion, bases of proximal phalanges of lateral four toes First lumbrical; medial plantar nerve, remainder: lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Extends toes at interphalangeal joints
Flexor digitorum longus tendon See Table 11.7
Flexor hallucis longus tendon See table 11.7
Third Layer
Flexor hallucis brevis Cuboid, lateral cuneiform, tibialis posterior insertion Medial tendon into medial side of base of proximal phalanx of big toe; lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of big toe Medial plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexes metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe, supports medial longitudinal arch
Adductor hallucis Oblique head bases of second, third, and fourth metatarsal bones; transverse head from plantar ligaments Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of big toe Deep branch lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexes metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe, holds together metatarsal bones
Flexor digiti minimi brevis Base of fifth metatarsal bone Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of little toe Lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Flexes metatarsophalangeal joint of little toe
Fourth Layer
Interossei
Dorsal (4) Adjacent sides of metatarsal bones Bases of proximal phalanges – first; medial side of second toe; remainder; lateral sides of second, third, and fourth toes – also dorsal extensor expansion Lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Abduction of toes; flexes metatarsophalangeal joints and extends interphalangeal joints
Plantar (3) Inferior surfaces of third, fourth and fifth metatarsal bones Medial side of bases of proximal phalanges of lateral three toes Lateral plantar nerve S2, 3 Adduction of toes; flexes metatarsophalangeal joints and extends interphalangeal joints
Fibularis See table 11.6
Tibialis posterior tendon See table 11.7
* The predominant nerve root supply is indicated by boldface type nerve

options.label: A
options.text: External beam radiation to the neck

questions.text: A 55 year old woman sees her physician with complaints of fatigue, headache, flank pain, hematuria, and abdominal pain. She undergoes a scan that demonstrates persistent uptake in the right superior parathyroid gland at 2 hours. Which of the following laboratory values is most suggestive of her diagnosis?
A 52-year-old woman presents with hypertension, obesity, and new skin striae. You are concerned about possible Cushing syndrome. Which of the following is the most common cause of Cushing syndrome?
Tonsils are collection of lymphoid tissue covered by a capsule which reaches its maximum size after puberty. All of the following are blood supply of tonsils, except?
Identify the type of joint between A and B in the given image.
Which among the following is derived from the pointed structure, if the blastocyst has completed its second week?

A 56-year-old woman is referred to you about 3 months after a colostomy subsequent to a sigmoid resection for cancer. She complains that her stoma is not functioning properly. Which of the following is the most common serious complication of an end colostomy?
Which of the following group of amino acids produce a common intermediate of TCA cycle?

A 45-year-old man is examined for a yearly executive physical. A mass is palpated in the rectum, and a biopsy suggests carcinoid. Which of the following findings is most likely to be associated with the carcinoid syndrome?
A 26 year old woman who is 15 weeks pregnant has a new onset of nausea, vomiting, and right-sided abdominal pain. The pain has become worse over the past 6 hours. What is the most likely diagnosis?

During endoscopic biopsy of a distal esophageal stricture, the patient complains of significant new substernal pain. He is hemodynamically stable. An immediate chest film reveals small pneumomediastinum. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

A 54 year old woman has been treated for 3 years for wheezing on exertion, which was diagnosed as asthma. Chest radiograph reveals a superior mediastinal mass compressing the trachea. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35 year old female presented with palmoplantar pigmentation. Further history revealed that the patient is a businesswoman who lives a sedantary lifestyle. Xray spine showed calcification of intervertebral discs. Urine sample of the patient turned greenish brown precipitate and blue black fluid when added with Benedict’s reagent. What is the likely cause in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Homogentisic acid Alkapton Bodies
↓ →

Accumulated

  • Cartilages →
 Nose, ear pinna, IV disc → Arthritis
  • Connective tissue
 bluish black colour
  • Ochronosis
 accumulation of Homogentisic acid in body

questions.text: A 63 year old man undergoes carotid endarterectomy. Postoperatively, he is noted to have an expanding ipsilateral neck hematoma. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

A man, with recurrent urinary tract infections, also reports a history of increasing difficulty in urination (decreased flow, straining, and hesitancy) over the last several months. PSA level is mildly elevated and prostate biopsy is benign. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial management of this patient with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)?
questions.correct_answer: D. Transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)

questions.text: A 33 year old farmer comes to the OPD with an itchy and flaky scalp for the past 10 days. The lesion had now started to form pus which was oozing at the time of examination. The image is given below. Which is the most common causative organism for this type of infection?

A trauma patient with a closed-head injury is being monitored in the neurosurgical ICU. His ICP measurement is seen to rise precipitously. An acute increase in ICP is characterized by which of the following clinical findings?

A 5 year old female child is brought to the Rural Health Centre by her mother with complaints of fluid filled, intensely itchy, painful reddish streaks for the past 3-4 days. Her younger sister also seemed to have developed the itchy sensations in between her fingers. Identify the wrong statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a superficial skin infection caused by the arthropod Strongyloidesstercoralis

options.label: B
options.text: The hallmark feature is that the itching is worse at nighttime

options.label: C
options.text: Topical permethrin is the treatment of choiceTopical permethrin is the treatment of choice

options.label: D
options.text: wash/dry all clothing with high heat or throwing away of bedding is recommended

questions.correct_answer: A. It's a superficial skin infection caused by the arthropod Strongyloidesstercoralis

questions.text: A study that helps to test the association between risk factor and disease is ?

Types Diseases Enzyme Deficient Affected Organ
I Von Gierke's [mc] GLUCOSE - 6 - (p)ase Liver
II POMPE'S [Lysosomal disease] Acid maltase Liver, Muscle, Brain
III CORI's/ LIMIT DEXTRINOSIS De branching Liver, Muscle, Brain
IV Mc ARDLES's Muscle phosphorylase Muscle
VI HER'S Liver Phosphorylase Liver

questions.text: A 22-year-old primigravida is about to undergo spinal anesthesia for an elective lower segment cesarean delivery. Which of the following is not a potential complication of spinal anesthesia?

options.text: Inadvertent change in the baricity of the solution when tetracaine is used

options.label: B
options.text: Paralysis of the abdominal and thoracic muscles that are involved in respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Sympathetic blockade resulting in vasodilation and hypotension

questions.correct_answer: A. Inadvertent change in the baricity of the solution when tetracaine is used

A 3 day old neonate is brought to the ER as he is dyspnoeic. A chest radiograph is ordered. Which one of the following statements will be true regarding the chest radiograph of this neonate?

options.label: A
options.text: The thymus may involute if the child is given steroid treatment

options.label: B
options.text: The ribs are more vertical than those in an older child’s radiograph

options.label: C
options.text: The cardio-thoracic ratio may be as 80%

options.label: D
options.text: A normal thymus may compress mediastinal structures

questions.correct_answer: A. The thymus may involute if the child is given steroid treatment

questions.text: Which of the following inhibits both gastric acid secretion and motility?
questions.explanation:
G.I.P Stimuli of Secretion - glucose /fat in duodenum,in large doses it inhibits gastric secretion and motility
V.I.P
  • They are inhibitory to the smooth muscles of the intestines.
  • It causes smooth muscle relaxation in the GIT --> decreases the motility
Somatostatin:
  • Central mechanism of inhibition of gastric acid secretion.
  • No role in inhibition of gastric motility or gastric emptying
Ghrelin:

Increases GH release from the pituitary.

Increases appetite by stimulating neuropeptide Y(NPY) in the feeding centers of the lateral hypothalamus.

Decreases the breakdown of fat and increases gastric motility and acid secretion.

Thus, ghrelin has effect on both gastric motility and secretion; it increases both.

questions.text: All are true about Paranasal sinuses, EXCEPT?

options.text: Develop as diverticula of the lateral nasal wall

Which of the following psychiatric findings best describes this style of train of thought?
A 16 yrs old boy presented with nasal obstruction. On following Xray a mass was seen hanging into the nasopharynx with air posterior-superior to the mass. This sign is known as:
The decerebrate rigidity is characterised by all of the following EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Rigidity occurs in all muscles of the body

options.label: B
options.text: There is increased ‘γ’ motor neuron discharge

options.label: C
options.text: Increased excitability of the motor neuron pool

options.label: D
options.text: Removal of cerebellum reduces the rigidity

questions.correct_answer: A. Rigidity occurs in all muscles of the body

questions.text: A 7-month-old male infant is noted by his mother to be difficult to care for. He is very difficult to feed or soothe, and often responds to cuddling by crying and becoming rigid in his mother’s arms. Physical examination and laboratory results are all normal. Which of the following psychiatric disorders is this infant might display in his early school years?

Two drugs act on the same tissue or organ via activation of different receptors, resulting in effects that are qualitatively the opposite of one another. An example would be the direct effects of norepinephrine and acetylcholine on heart rate. This represents which of the following types of antagonism?

A 28-year-old man is admitted to the psychiatric unit after his parents find him in his room talking to himself and telling them that he is convinced that people are going to hurt him. During his stay in the hospital, the patient is frequently found standing in the center of his room with both arms over his head, immobile. It is observed that the patient can maintain this position for hours at a time. Which of the following best describes this patient’s posturing?

In a patient with essential hypertension, and unusually high circulating catecholamine levels, the treatment goal is to block both α- and β-adrenergic receptors using just one drug. Which of the following is capable of doing that?

An “effective dose” of atropine is given to a person who was poisoned with an AChE inhibitor. Which of the following structures will continue to be overactivated by the excess ACh after the atropine is given?

A 72-year-old man with a dementing disorder dies in a car accident. During the previous 5 years, his personality had dramatically changed and he had caused much embarrassment to his family because of his intrusive and inappropriate behavior. Pathological examination of his brain shows frontotemporal atrophy, gliosis of the frontal lobes’ white matter, characteristic intracellular inclusions, and swollen neurons. Amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary tangles are absent. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Meperidine is similar to morphine in many ways. However, with very high blood levels or with true overdoses, meperidine can cause significant adverse responses that aren’t seen with morphine or most other opioid analgesics. Which of the following best identifies that rather unique effect of meperidine?

A 2-year-old infant is diagnosed with meningitis. A lumbar puncture reveals numerous neutrophils and gram-positive cocci in pairs that appear encapsulated. She is admitted to the hospital and started on intravenous (IV) β-lactams. Which of the following targets would most likely play a role in the development of resistance to this antibiotic in the most likely etiologic agent of this child’s meningitis?

A patient with leukemia has a chest CT finding that suggests aspergillosis. Which of the following antimicrobials affects ergosterol synthesis and would most likely be used in this patient’s treatment?

A sexually active woman was seen for a routine gynecologic exam that included a Pap smear. The report indicated cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. In situ hybridization showed the presence of HPV type 16 genomes within the neoplastic cells. Which of the following processes is required for HPV to lead to the development of cancer?

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of HPV E6 and E7 genes

questions.correct_answer: A. Integration of the viral genome

questions.text: A patient with burning epigastric pain is admitted to the hospital, and a gastric biopsy is performed. The tissue is cultured on chocolate agar incubated in a microaerophilic environment at 98.6°F (37°C) for 5 to 7 days. On the fifth day of incubation, colonies appear on the plate and curved, gram-negative, oxidase-positive rods are observed. Which of the following is the most likely identity of this organism?
questions.explanation:
Diagnostic tests for helicobacter pylori
Advantages Disadvantages
Noninvasive
Serum ELISA Inexpensive Not useful for follow-up
Urea breath test Useful for follow-up Expensive; may be falsely negative in patients on acid suppression therapy
Stool antigen test Inexpensive; useful for follow up Inconvenient
Whole blood assay Inexpensive; rapid Less accurate than serum ELISA
Invasive (endoscopic)
Histology Visualization of pathology May miss low-grade infection
Rapid urease Rapid May be falsely positive in bacterial overgrowth
Culture Antibiotic susceptibility Not maximally sensitive; not available routinely; required 4 - 7 days

questions.text: Mycoplasmas have been cultivated from human mucous membranes and tissues, especially from the genital, urinary, and respiratory tracts. Chlamydia can be isolated from many of these sources as well. Both cause respiratory and genital tract infections. Adults may present with asymptomatic respiratory infection to serious pneumonitis, and identification of the etiologic agent usually determines the best antimicrobial treatment. Which of the following best describes the difference between mycoplasmas and chlamydiae?

options.label: A
options.text: Able to cause disease in humans

options.label: B
options.text: Able to cause urinary tract infection

options.label: C
options.text: Able to grow on artificial cell-free media

questions.correct_answer: C. Able to grow on artificial cell-free media

questions.text: A 50 year old woman, who is homeless and very dehydrated presents to the ER. There is lice in her hair and clothing. The patient reported high fever, severe headaches, and muscle pain. A petechial rash was observed all over her body. After 72 hours in the hospital, the woman died. A Gram-stain of the organism showed a weakly staining Gram-negative bacterium that could not be grown in vitro. What organism was the most likely cause of her infection?

Flagellate parasite is the cause of vaginalis in women in temperate areas. It is a sexually transmittable disease. The prominent symptom is copious fowl-smelling yellow discharge that can be accompanied by cervical lesions and abdominal pain. What parasite does this represent?

After playing in the bushes during a camping trip, a 7-year-old girl complains of intense itching and blistering of the hands, arms, and legs. Which of the following are the most likely medical condition and the correct hypersensitivity diagram from those presented?
questions.correct_answer: B. Contact dermatitis and type IV

questions.text: The germline antigen receptor loci for both alpha and beta chains of the TCR are found in:

An AIDS patient with a CD4 count in the range 100 to 50 cells/mm3 complains of headache and neck stiffness and appears disoriented. The possibility of fungal meningitis is considered and tests for the common fungal etiology of meningitis ordered. Tests included direct examination of spinal fluid for the organism and serology. The purpose of the serology test is detection of

A drug is given to a Parkinson’s disease patient that acts in the CNS as an agonist for dopamine receptors. It has no direct effects on dopamine synthesis, neuronal reuptake, or metabolic inactivation. Which of the following drugs best fits this description?

After a few weeks on a drug, a patient reports profound thirst and the production of copious volumes of clear (dilute) urine each day. Which of the following drugs is most likely responsible for the signs and symptoms?
A patient has periodic episodes of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia (PSVT). Which of the following drugs would be most suitable for outpatient prophylaxis in this patient?

A 25 year old nonpregnant woman has been using a preparation of oral ergotamine to manage her frequent migraine headaches. She consumes an excessive dose of the drug while trying to abort a particularly severe and refractory attack. Which of the following adverse cardiac or cardiovascular consequences are most likely to occur as a result of the ergot overdose?

options.label: A
options.text: Myocardial and peripheral ischemia due to intense vasoconstriction

options.label: C
options.text: Spontaneous bleeding due to direct inhibition of platelet activation/aggregation

questions.correct_answer: A. Myocardial and peripheral ischemia due to intense vasoconstriction

questions.text: Furosemide’s main mechanism of action involves inhibition of a Na+,K+, 2Cl− cotransporter. In which part of the nephron is this cotransporter located?
questions.correct_answer: A. Ascending limb, loop of Henle

questions.text: A patient presents with a history of frequent and severe migraine headaches. When one of the more commonly used drugs for abortive therapy is given, sumatriptan, upon which of the following “local control substances” is it mainly acting?

A patient has steatorrhea due to pancreatic insufficiency secondary to cystic fibrosis. Which of the following drugs usually is considered the most reasonable and usually effective drug for managing the steatorrhea?

A 19-year-old female is evaluated in a clinic for a complaint of amenorrhea. She has not had her menarche yet and has had only minimal breast growth. Past medical history is significant for a diagnosis of borderline hypertension. In childhood the patient frequently had otitis media and varicella infections. She has received the standard vaccinations. She recently graduated from high school and has no learning difficulties. On physical examination, the patient is of short stature. Blood pressure is 145/90.The nipples appear widely spaced, with only breast buds present. Her external genitalia appear normal. Bimanual vaginal examination reveals an anteverted, anteexed uterus. The ovaries are not palpable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30 year old G1P1 female was admitted in the delivery room due to labor pain. She has twins with cephalic presentation. The head of the baby was engaged but was not delivered even after 16 hours of labor. Finally, both the babies were delivered at 20 hours,however the patient started to bleed a lot. Which of the following is the correct treatment option in this patient?

A 33-year-old woman arrives at the emergency department after experiencing a transient state of altered mental status en route to Delhi from Moscow. From the reports of the other passengers and flight attendants on the plane, she was normally interactive throughout most of the flight but was difficult to arouse from sleep upon landing. Upon trying to exit the plane, she couldn't maintain her balance and fell. Her mental status immediately improved when she received naloxone, thiamine, and IV glucose via an emergency response team. Upon arrival at the emergency department 1 h later, she appears anxious but is alert, oriented, and appropriate. Temperature is 36°C, blood pressure is 165/85 mmHg, heart rate is 110 beats/min, respiratory rate is 24 breaths/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. All other laboratory tests are normal. A urine toxicology screen reveals heroin metabolites. What is the next step in diagnosis?
A patient with metabolic acidosis, reduced anion gap, and increased osmolal gap is most likely to have which of the following toxic ingestions?

A 2 days old neonate after delivery, was noted to be irritable, poor latch and difficulty in breathing. Temperature was noted to be 34.5 C. You suspect neonatal sepsis and order for a blood culture. All of the following are components of positive sepsis screening, except?

A 22-year-old man with bipolar disorder, who is on lithium, is brought to the ER in an arousable but dysarthric state and he has a markedly abnormal gait when trying to walk. 15 minutes later he has a grand mal seizure. In the postictal stage, he is not arousable to sternal rub and lacks a gag reflex. His serum sodium returns at 157 meq/L. In reference to the above clinical situation, all of the following are next steps in his management except

A 35-year-old man is invited to a Health camp for a routine checkup. He has no complaints. Past medical history is notable for scoliosis that was surgically corrected at the age of 14. Family history is notable for a father and a brother with colon cancer at ages 45 and 50 years, respectively. Physical examination is notable for normal vital signs, a tall stature with hypermobile joints, normal skin, and ectopia lentis. The remainder of the examination is normal. Which of the following annual studies would you recommend to this patient?
All of the following are seen in this type of placenta, except?

options.label: A
options.text: Chorionic plate is smaller than decidual plate

options.label: B
options.text: There is presence of central clearing

options.label: C
options.text: It is associated with painless bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: Doubled up membrane on the periphery is seen

questions.correct_answer: C. It is associated with painless bleeding

questions.text: A newborn after delivery failed to pass meconium for 48 hours. Associated findings revealed Biliary emesis and abdominal distension indicating the presence of intestinal obstruction. Examination revealed doughy abdominal wall. Investigations indicated diagnosis of meconium ileus. This disorder can be an early manifestation of which of the following?

A 47-year-old man is being evaluated for weakness and a progressive change in mental status. After extensive evaluation, he is diagnosed with a mitochondrial disorder. All of the following statements about mitochondrial disorders are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: The mitochondrial genome does not recombine.

options.label: C
options.text: The proportion of wild-type and mutant mitochondria in different tissues is identical.

options.label: D
options.text: Cardiomyopathy is a feature of many mitochondrial disorders

questions.correct_answer: C. The proportion of wild-type and mutant mitochondria in different tissues is identical.

questions.text: A 28 years old G1P1 came for prenatal check-up at 5 months AOG. No abnormal findings were seen. The same patient after two months, had blood pressure of 145/90 mm Hg with an episode of convulsion already. What is the diagnosis of this patient?
The device given in the image can be used in all of the following areas, except?
questions.explanation:
• Areas where skin fold thickness is measured:
    • Supra scapular
    • Subscapular
    • Biceps
    • Triceps
  • Tanner’s charts used previously
  • WHO charts are used now

questions.text: A 55-year-old alcoholic man is admitted to the hospital for upper gastrointestinal bleeding. From further history and physical examination,his bleeding is from gingival membranes. He had hemarthrosis evacuated 7 months ago. Laboratory data show platelets of 240,000, INR of 1.1. He has a diffuse hemorrhagic eruption on his legs . What is the recommended treatment for this patient’s underlying disorder?

A 22-year old woman who suffered the effects of Anorexia Nervosa for 8 years with a body mass index of 17 kg/m2 comes to the OPD with complaints of intense abdominal pain. Which of the following characteristics of Anorexia nervosa is least likely to improve despite successful treatment?

A 3 year old boy with a congenial heart disease, otherwise normal looking was brought to emergency department. Past history revealed Cyanosis of the lips and oral mucosa while crying for the past 6-8 months. Which among the following is not an useful treatment for the given condition?

A 60-year-old woman presents to the emergency room complaining of jaundice. She also noticed clay-colored stools and pruritus. She has a past medical history of alcohol abuse, but has been abstinent for the past 10 years. She has no known history of cirrhosis. On physical examination, she is febrile with normal vital signs. Liver function testing reveals an AST of 125 IU/L, ALT of 165 IU/L, alkaline phosphatase of 481 U/L, total bilirubin of 23.1 mg/dL, and direct bilirubin of 17.2 mg/dL. On right upper quadrant ultrasound, the gallbladder cannot be visualized and there is dilatation of the intrahepatic bile ducts. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old man comes to the OPD with complaints of 3 weeks of malaise and fevers.He has a history of hypertension he smokes one pack of cigarettes per day. His physical examination shows a systolic heart murmur heard best in the mitral region. Blood cultures grow Streptococcus bovis and echocardiogram shows a <1-cm vegetation on the mitral valve. What is the next step in diagnosis?

A 50-year-old woman with atrial fibrillation is on warfarin, 5 mg daily. She developed a urinary tract infection and was treated with ciprofloxacin, 250 mg orally twice daily for 7 days. She presents to the emergency room complaining of blood in her urine and easy bruising. Her physical examination shows ecchymoses on her arms. Her urine is bloody in appearance, but no clots are present. After flushing the bladder with 100 mL of sterile saline, the urine returns with a slight pink hue only. What is the best approach to treatment of this patient’s coagulopathy?

options.label: B
options.text: Transfuse four units of fresh-frozen plasma.

options.label: D
options.text: Hold further warfarin doses until the INR falls

questions.correct_answer: C. Administer vitamin K 1 mg sublingually.

questions.text: A 43-year-old male comes to the OP with complaints of a nodule in his chest x-ray. The chest radiogram showed a small right lower lobe alveolar infiltrate and a left upper lobe nodule. He was treated with antibiotics and is now asymptomatic. A repeat chest radiogram shows that the right lower lobe infiltrate is resolved, but the nodule is still present. He is asymptomatic. His past history is notable for smoking one pack of cigarettes per day for 25 years and he quit 3 years ago. Which of the following is the appropriate next step in his management?
The triad of portal vein thrombosis, hemolysis, and pancytopenia suggests which of the following diagnoses?
Gestational Diabetes mellitus is due to increased human placental lactogen after 24 weeks of gestation. All of the following methods are used for screening this condition according to ADA, except?

options.label: A
options.text: Glucose challenge test with 50 grams of sugar in a non fasting woman

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose tolerance test with 100 grams of sugar in a non fasting woman

options.label: C
options.text: Glucose tolerance test with 100 grams of sugar in a fasting woman

options.label: D
options.text: Glucose tolerance test with 75 grams of sugar in a non fasting woman

questions.correct_answer: D. Glucose tolerance test with 75 grams of sugar in a non fasting woman
questions.explanation:
1 hr value < 190

2 hr value < 165

3 hr value < 145

Any 2 or more abnormal values

↓

Diagnostic of GDM

  • Fasting
 → < 92 Any one abnormal valve
  • At 1 hr
 → < 180 Is Dx of GDM
  • At 2 hrs
 → < 153

questions.text: A 32-year-old patient comes to the OPD with persistent iron deficiency anemia. He has a past medical history of end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis. Also he has hypertension, and rheumatoid arthritis. His medications include calcium acetate, a multivitamin, nifedipine, aspirin, iron sulfate, and omeprazole. His hemoglobin 6 months ago was 8 mg/dL. One week ago, it was 7.9 mg/dL. What is the most likely cause of this patient’s iron deficiency anemia?

A 17-year-old male has recurrent thigh hematomas. He has been active in sports and has had 3 episodes of limb-threatening bleeding with compartment syndrome. A family history is notable for a maternal grandfather with a similar bleeding history. Paternal family history is not available. Laboratory results are normal. What is the most likely reason for his coagulation disorder?

A 32 years old G1P1 female with poor prenatal history, presented with labor pain at 34 weeks of gestation. After delivering the baby, the patient presented with postpartum hemorrhage. Whereas the baby was found to be deaf and an IUGR baby. Which of the following can be a cause of it?
questions.explanation:
Maternal Complications Neonatal Complications
  • Abortion
  • Preterm labor
  • Pre-eclamptic toxemia
  • Abruption
  • PPH
  • ↑Morbidity & Mortality
  • Cretinism
  • ↓ IQ-
  • Neuro Psychiatric Illness
  • Poor cognitive development
  • Deafness & growth restriction

questions.text: A patient comes to the clinic and describes progressive muscle weakness over several weeks. He has also experienced nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Few weeks ago he went on a trip to China where he ate some different dishes of meat. Soon after he returned, his gastrointestinal symptoms began, followed by muscle weakness. Examination confirms decreased muscle strength in the upper extremities and neck. Which of the following organisms is most likely the cause of his symptoms?
In the given ECG strip, what type of conduction abnormality is present and where in the conduction pathway is the block usually found?
questions.correct_answer: B. Second-degree AV block type 1; intranodal

questions.text: A 15 year old boy was brought to a pediatrician with complaints of repetitive bilateral myoclonic jerks for the past week. The seizures primarily developed in early morning hours with short duration and not associated with any loss of consciousness. Past history revealed 2-3 episodes of sudden activity interruption with blank stare for short duration an year ago which the parents did not take it as an issue. An EEG was ordered which showed 4 Hz-polyspikes with slow waveforms. Which of the following can be the best treatment option in this patient?

A 24-year-old woman is admitted in the ICU with rhabdomyolysis due to compartment syndrome of the lower extremities after a car accident. Her clinical course has been complicated by acute renal failure and severe pain. An electrocardiogram is done which is shown below. What is the most appropriate course of action?

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous fluids and a loop diuretic

questions.correct_answer: C. Intravenous fluids and a loop diuretic

questions.text: A pregnant patient developed rashes, conjunctivitis and neuropathy. She became normal after a month and later when she delivered her baby, the baby was noted to have Microcephaly, ocular abnormalities and intracranial calcifications. What is the infective agent that had caused these symptoms?

An 11 year old girl was admitted for recurrent gross hematuria for the past 4 days. There is no history of pain in the abdomen or pyuria. Past history revealed bad throat 4 days ago. Lab tests revealed no significant findings in Urine culture sterile, Serum IgA and C3. Which of the following can be the most likely cause in this patient?
A patient has a holosystolic murmur on physical examination. With deep inspiration, the intensity of the murmur increases. This is consistent with which of the following?

A 25-year-old man collapses immediately after being hit in the chest with a ball while playing football. Emergency medical services were present at the location and noticed a ventricular fibrillation presentation in the patent. Immediate defibrillation was attempted and a normal sinus rhythm was restored. The patient is transported to the emergency room and is now stable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7 year old child was brought by his parents as a result of bleeding gums, poor feeding and irritability. Past history revealed the patient was fed with cow milk in his early years. Physical examination showed petechiae and beading of costo-chondral junction. Which of the following is not true about the beading seen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The beading seen in this patient is called as Rachitic Rosary

options.label: B
options.text: The beading seen in this patient is sharp and angulated

options.label: C
options.text: The beading is associated with pseudoparalysis of the child

questions.correct_answer: A. The beading seen in this patient is called as Rachitic Rosary

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction and congestive heart failure is comfortable at rest. However, when walking to his car, he develops dyspnea, fatigue, and sometimes palpitations. He must rest for several minutes before these symptoms resolve. His New York Heart Association classification is which of the following?

A primigravida female, three months after missing her menstruation started vomiting now and then. Month after month, it became more worse to a stage where she could not eat anything and always felt nauseous. She noticed that her weight did not significantly increase as the pregnancy advanced. Which of the following can be a complication in this condition?
A 6 year old boy wets his bed during sleep. His parents were told that it is normal till 5 years of age. After consulting, what is the first line management to this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Early dinner with restricted fluid intake after

questions.correct_answer: D. Early dinner with restricted fluid intake after

questions.text: A 22 year old patient presented with severe abdominal pain that worsened few minutes ago. Further history revealed that her LMP was before 4 months. Past history showed previous consultation for Pelvic Inflammatory disease an year ago. The patient appeared to be anaemic with tenderness in the lower abdomen. Bruising was noted around the umbilicus and flank region. Aspiration from pouch of Douglas revealed presence of blood. What can be the correct treatment option in this patient?

A G2P2 is at the delivery room and is in active phase of labor. You are assigned in the delivery room and you check the presentation of the fetus. Imagining if the fetus shows vertex presentation, which of the following is true regarding the diameter of fetalskull with incomplete flexion attitude of head?
questions.explanation:
Diameter Measurement Attitude of Head Presentation
1. Suboccipito-bregmatic 9.5cm Complete flexion Vertex
2. Suboccipito frontal 10cm Incomplete flexion Vertex
3. Occipito frontal 11.5cm Incomplete flexion Vertex
4. Mento vertical 14cm Deflexed head / military position Brow
5. Submento vertical 11.5cm Incomplete extension Face
6. Submentobregmatic 9.5cm Complete extension Face

questions.text: A diabetic mother had difficulty delivering the baby. During delivery, after the head the shoulder did not follow. The Obstetrician managed the case by doing a maneuver given in the image along with application of suprapubic pressure. How did he manage this patient deliver the baby?
A 65 year old diabetic man presented with sudden appearance of black floaters in the eye. Which of the following is investigation of choice ?

Two women A and B came for consultation. A presented with complaint of menstrual pain which starts 4 days prior to her periods and continues throughout menses. On further examination, she was diagnosed with Endometriosis. B complained of irregular acyclical menstrual bleeding and she was diagnosed with presence of polyps. Name the specific diagnosis of A and B respectively.

A 30 year old female presented with chronic abdominal pain with acute monthly exacerbation. Further history revealed menorrhagia and painful sex. CA 125 level was increased. Laparoscopy showed blue spots with deposits on ovary with scarring and adhesions with fallopian tube. Which is the surgical treatment option in this patient?

A 60 year old female presented with complaints of mood swings and insomnia. She also developed intense heat with sweating all over her face and chest which becomes normal in few minutes. What is the drug of choice for the later symptom?
Outer Blood Retinal Barrier is formed by

A 22-year-old woman presents with severe dysmenorrhea. Indomethacin is prescribed to treat her symptoms. This drug may reduce her pain because it interferes with the production of which one of the following substances?
Which type of retinal detachment most commonly seen in proliferative diabetic retinopathy ?

Physical examination of a newborn infant reveals underdeveloped limbs forming short stumps without fingers or toes (phocomelia). This developmental abnormality is most consistent with intrauterine exposure to which substance?

A 62 year old female patient presented with an abdominal mass. Further evaluation showed raised CA 125 levels. Transvaginalsonography showed presence of large mass in the right ovary. The patient was diagnosed with Ovarianteratoma. Staging Laparatomy was done and while performing, the surgeon accidentally ruptured the intact capsule. What is the treatment option in this patient?

A man presents with unexplained weight loss and a few enlarged lymph nodes. An enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay for HIV antibody detection is positive, and a confirmatory Western blot test is ordered. This test is reported as positive, as bands for p24 and gp41 are present. Which HIV gene codes for the p24 antigen?
Surgery of choice in patient with congenital ptosis with good levator action is

A premature male infant born at 28 weeks’ gestation to a 21 year old woman with gestational diabetes develops problems breathing about 14 h after delivery. Physical examination finds cyanosis, tachypnea, and nasal flaring. A chest x-ray reveals a bilateral diffuse reticular (“ground glass”) appearance. His respiratory problems worsen and he is put on a ventilator. Which one of the following therapies should also be given at this time?
All are signs of Fuch’s heterochomic iridocyclitis, EXCEPT ?

Which one of the listed disorders is a type of childhood malnutrition that is caused by insufficient dietary protein and most commonly occurs when a child is weaned from breast milk and placed on a diet that is high in starches and carbohydrates but deficient in protein?
Limbus stem cells are situated in:

A woman presents with a new onset of a watery, foul- smelling vaginal discharge. A Gram stain of this discharge reveals squamous epithelial cells that are covered by small gram variable rods. Pap smears show the presence of “clue cells.” This abnormality is most closely associated with which one of the listed organisms?
The cataract which liquefies at an advanced stage causing lens material to liquefy and settle at the bottom is called:
A 56 year old female is diagnosed with open angle glaucoma and was given topical beta blocker therapy to the patient. Which of the following is not a side effect of topical beta blockers

In a patient with vasculitis, the finding of serum antineutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibodies (ANCAs) that react by immunofluorescence staining in a cytoplasmic staining pattern (C-ANCAs) is most suggestive of which one of the following diseases?

A18 year old girl presented with Amenorrhea for the past 4 months. She also addressed that there was scanty bleeding before the amenorrhea. Pregnancy test was negative. Recently, she developed increased hair growth in face and other parts of her body. The patient wants to know about the drug that would treat the later condition.

A 3-year-old girl is being evaluated for growth and developmental delay. She has had several past episodes when she would suddenly have trouble breathing, become blue, and then assume a squatting position to catch her breath. Workup finds increased thickness of the right ventricle and dextroposition of the aorta. Which of the following cardiovascular abnormalities is most likely to be present in this child?
questions.correct_answer: C. Stenosis of the pulmonic valve

questions.text: A 25 years old G1P1 female from a village presented to the labor room for delivery. It was noted that the patient had no antenatal visits during pregnancy. Despite having good uterine contractions, there was no progress of labor. There was minimal or no descent of presenting part. All of the following can be a cause for this, except?

A 70 year old female presented with vulvar mass. On examination, the mass was already a significant part of lower 1/3rd of vagina. No lymph nodes were involved. What would be the treatment option for this patient?
questions.explanation:
STAGE I Limited to Vulva
I AI B Size →< 2 cm, invasion < 1mmSize →> 2 cm, invasion > 1mm
STAGE II Adjacent organ involvement
Lower 1/3 rd vaginaLower 1/3 rd of urethraAnus
STAGE III Inguino femoral LN involvement
III Ai Aii One LN → > 5 mmOne or two LN → < 5 mm
III Bi Bii Two LN → > 5 mmMore than 3 LN → < 5 mm
III C LN involvement Å, with extra capsular spread
STAGE IV
IV Ai Aii Upper urethra, upper vagina, rectal involvement, growth stuck to pelvic boneFixed or ulcerated LN
IV B Distant metastasis Pelvic LN

STAGE I A Limited to Vulva Size < 2cms, Invasion < 1mm

Wide Local Incision + Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy

  • Sentinel LN Biopsy
    • If negative →Radical vulvectomy alone
    • If positive →Radical vulvectomy + LN removal
STAGE I B Size > 2 cmsInvasion < 1mm Radical Local Incision Central Lesion: B/L LAD Lateral Lesion: U/L LAD(> 2 cm from midline)
STAGE II Any size: Spread to Lower 1/3 urethra, Lower 1/3 vagina, Anus Radical Vulvectomy Plus B/L LAD
STAGE III Inguino-Femoral LN positive Radiation + Surgery + LAD
STAGE IV IV A: Upper Urethra, Upper Vagina, Bladder, Rectum Pelvic side wallIV B: Distant Metastasis Pelvic LN Radiation + Surgery + LAD

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy whose factor VIII activity is less than 10% of normal is most at risk for developing which one of the following clinical signs?

A couple presented with complaints of Infertility. Having no significant history causing the problem, Semen analysis was performed which showed absence of sperm. Ovulation tests showed normal results. Which among the sperm extraction techniques that should be performed in this patient, is suitable to be done under general anaesthesia?

A 13 year old girl was brought by her parents complaining of absence of menstrual onset. On examination, there was presence of menstrual blood and a diagnosis of Cryptomenorrhea was made. All of the following can be a cause of this condition, except?

A 8 year old boy accidentally inhales a small peanut, which lodges in one of his bronchi. A chest x-ray reveals the mediastinum to be shifted toward the side of the obstruction. Which of the following pulmonary abnormalities is most likely present in this boy?
Name the procedure indicated in the image, if the dotted linedenotes the resected portion.

A 5-year-old boy presents with multiple laryngeal squamous papillomas. Obtaining a history, this boy has had the same types of lesions removed in the past, but they have now recurred. Which of the following viruses is most closely associated with this boy’s condition?
A 2-week-old infant with a firm, ovoid, olive-shaped palpable mass in the region of the pylorus would most likely have which one of the listed findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Cyanosis that is worse when feeding

options.label: D
options.text: Peristaltic bowel sounds in the thorax

questions.text: An anxious 20-year-old woman presents with perioral numbness and carpopedal spasm. Laboratory examination reveals decreased PCO2 and decreased bicarbonate. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Metabolic acidosis due to renal tubular acidosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Respiratory alkalosis due to hyperventilation

questions.text: An uncircumcised 45-year-old man presents with sudden onset of severe pain in the distal portion of his penis. The emergency room physician examines the patient and finds that the foreskin is retracted but cannot be rolled back over the glans penis. An emergency resection of this patient’s foreskin is done. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old man presents with bone pain and is found to have hypocalcemia and increased parathyroid hormone. Surgical exploration of his neck finds all four of his parathyroid glands to be enlarged. Which of the following disorders is the most likely cause of this patient’s enlarged parathyroid glands?

Sections of bone histologically show normal-sized trabeculae that are partially calcified and have enlarged seams of uncalcified osteoid. Which of the following is the most likely cause of these histologic changes?
A patient consumes an excessive dose of theophylline and develops toxicity in response to the drug. Which of the following is the most likely consequence of this?
The unloading of O 2 inperipheral capillaries facilitates the loading of CO 2 , and oxygenation in the lung enhances the unloading of CO 2 , this is termed as ?
